trial_identification.studytitle: Validation of a Checklist for Regional Anaesthesia Procedural Skills Assessment
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Validation of a Checklist for Regional Anaesthesia Procedural Skills Assessment

interventions.interventions: Validation of a direct observed procedural skills assessment tool for regional anaesthesia. This tool is constructed as a checklist with objective criteria for satisfactory completion of procedural tasks in the performance of a nerve block. This checklist is completed immediately after the nerve block is performed.
interventions.comparator: expert assessors using scripted videos versus clinical videos

primaryOutcome.outcome: validation of checklist by inter-rater comparison between expert assessors

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All patients presenting for surgery and labour ward requiring regional anaesthesia All anaesthesia trainees
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: incapacity, inability, and/or refusal to give informed consent for participation

trial_design.statisticalmethods: inter-rater reliability using intraclass correlation coefficients and kappa statistic

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary outcome of this study is to establish construct validity and reliability of the RAPS checklist. Construct validity describes the ability of the tool to measure the criteria under assessment, and its discriminatory power to differentiate novice versus skilled proceduralists. Reliability of the tool is its ability to be reproducible between different assessors.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Chuan A et al. Design and validation of the Regional Anaesthesia Procedural Skills Assessment Tool. Anaesthesia 2015; 70(12): 1401-1411
